channel.title: BSoD Stop Code 0x50 from running eclipse
channel.description:
So I've narrowed it down to it either being registry problems or gfx driver problems. The thing is I've downloaded multiple registry fixing programs and they said they fixed them and also I reinstalled my gfx drivers aswell as following microsoft's solution to fixing it and none of it works.
It happens when I use so much memory even acting using the internet for periods of time. I got this from upgrading my windows 7 from home to ultimate if that may help. Anyone care to help me?

item.title: BSoD Stop Code 0x50 from running eclipse
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Windows 8 fixed it. Haha.

Read full topic

item.title: BSoD Stop Code 0x50 from running eclipse
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:3, topic:469326”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=586477.msg4163831#msg4163831 date=1353444689]
So downgrade back to windows 7 home premium.
[/quote]you can’t downgrade[/quote]

You can pirate it.
If you bought Windows 7 genuinely, it would come with an activation key which you could use to activate the home premium again.

Read full topic
